name: Business Models, Cost Structures, and Regulatory Compliance

chapters.name: Cost Analysis, Funding, and Affordability
topics: How do upfront hardware costs, ongoing maintenance, and support expenses compare to traditional guide dog programs?
What funding models (public, private, philanthropic, subscription) could make robotic guide dogs widely accessible?
How can cost-benefit analyses account for intangible benefits like independence, employment opportunities, and safety?
What strategies can prevent a two-tier system where only wealthy users gain access to advanced robotic guides?

chapters.name: Regulatory, Legal, and Liability Considerations
topics: How do existing service animal and accessibility laws apply, or fail to apply, to robotic guide dogs?
Who bears liability when a robotic guide dog is involved in an accident, and how should legal frameworks evolve?
What certifications, safety audits, or approvals might be required before deployment in public spaces?
How can international differences in regulation affect global deployment strategies for these systems?

chapters.name: Accessibility Integration with Infrastructure and Services
topics: How should public transit, buildings, and streetscapes be adapted to support robotic guide dog navigation?
What collaborations with transit agencies, employers, and schools are needed to enable seamless travel for users?
How can digital infrastructure like mapping services, beacons, and signage be leveraged to aid robotic guidance?
What standards and interoperability requirements could ensure that different vendors' systems work reliably across cities?
